definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: The landlady of the hotel entered.
Proprietress in and talk about a person.
sentences.chinese: 老板娘在和一个人谈论。

sentences.english: Then madame, with her teeth set, tied a very terrible knot indeed.
sentences.chinese: 老板娘咬牙切齿地抽紧了一个很可怕的结。

sentences.english: The proprietor was a Greek with hairy arms.
sentences.chinese: 这个老板娘是个希腊人，手臂上长满了汗毛。

sentences.english: And with the help of the wife of shop-owner yu shangguang and others, to the blue sky to protect.
sentences.chinese: 并在老板娘上官玉等人的帮助下，对蓝天竭力保护。

sentences.english: And to kill John Doe and the proprietress .
They were there Naoteng, she almost shock.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩在那里闹腾，老板娘差点休克。

definition: variant of 老闆|老板[lao3 ban3]
big sister/elder sister/older sister (also polite term of address for a girl or woman slightly older than the speaker)
maternal aunt/step-mother/childcare worker/nursemaid/woman of similar age to one's parents (term of address used by child)/CL:個|个[ge4]
eldest of father's younger brothers/uncle (term used to address a man about the age of one's father)
